info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 10:30PM EDT until August 25 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN OAKLAND COUNTY... At 1029 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Detroit to near Dearborn to near Romulus, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Oakland County, including the following locations... Franklin, Keego Harbor, Waterford, Orchard Lake, Commerce, Lathrup Village, Auburn Hills, Bingham Farms, Farmington Hills and Pleasant Ridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
